snippet: The National Transportation Safety Board said preventable safety blunders and lax federal regulation led to the disastrous 2010 rupture and oil spill in the Kalamazoo River.
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board says preventable safety blunders by pipeline operator Enbridge and lax federal regulation led to the disastrous 2010 rupture and oil spill in the Kalamazoo River in Michigan.
lead_paragraph: The National Transportation Safety Board said preventable safety blunders and lax federal regulation led to the disastrous 2010 rupture and oil spill in the Kalamazoo River.

headline.main: Michigan: Board Finds Shared Blame for Oil Spill
headline.print_headline: Michigan: Board Finds Shared Blame For Oil Spill
